name: Diclofenac Sodium

( 2 ) • apply diclofenac sodium topical solution , clean , dry skin . ( 2.1 ) • dispense 40 mg ( 2 pump actuations ) directly onto knee first hand onto knee . spread evenly around front , back sides knee . ( 2.1 ) • wash hands completely administering product . ( 2.2 ) • wait area completely dry covering clothing applying sunscreen , insect repellent , cosmetics , topical medications , substances . ( 2.2 ) • treated knee ( ) completely dry , avoid skin-to-skin contact people treated knee ( ) . ( 2.2 ) • get diclofenac sodium topical solution eyes , nose , mouth ( 2.2 ) .
warningsAndPrecautions: diclofenac sodium topical solution , usp 2 % w/w , supplied clear , colorless free flowing viscous solution containing 20 mg diclofenac sodium per gram solution , white polypropylene-dose pump bottle clear cap . pump actuation delivers 20 mg diclofenac sodium 1 gram solution . ndc number & size 112 g bottle ndc # 68788-8838-1 storage store 20°c 25°c ( 68°f 77°f ) ; excursions permitted 15°c 30°c ( 59°f 86°f ) [ usp controlled room temperature ] .
adverseReactions: diclofenac sodium topical solution contraindicated following patients : •known hypersensitivity ( e.g . , anaphylactic serious skin ) diclofenac components product [ ( 5.7 , 5.9 ) ] •history asthma , urticaria , allergic-type taking aspirin nsaids . severe , sometimes fatal , anaphylactic nsaids reported patients [ ( 5.7 , 5.8 ) ] •in setting coronary artery bypass graft ( cabg ) surgery [ ( 5.1 ) ]
indications_original: Diclofenac sodium topical solution is indicated for the treatment of the pain of osteoarthritis of the knee(s).
contraindications_original: Use the lowest effective dosage for the shortest duration consistent with individual patient treatment goals. The recommended dose is 2 pump actuations on each painful knee, 2 times a day. ( 2 ) • Apply diclofenac sodium topical solution, to clean, dry skin. ( 2.1 ) • Dispense 40 mg (2 pump actuations) directly onto the knee or first into the hand and then onto the knee. Spread evenly around front, back and sides of the knee. ( 2.1 ) • Wash hands completely after administering the product. ( 2.2 ) • Wait until the area is completely dry before covering with clothing or applying sunscreen, insect repellent, cosmetics, topical medications, or other substances. ( 2.2 ) • Until the treated knee(s) is completely dry, avoid skin-to-skin contact between other people and the treated knee(s). ( 2.2 ) • Do not get diclofenac sodium topical solution in your eyes, nose, or mouth ( 2.2 ).
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Diclofenac sodium topical solution, USP 2% w/w, is supplied as a clear, colorless free flowing viscous solution containing 20 mg of diclofenac sodium per gram of solution, in a white polypropylene-dose pump bottle with a clear cap. Each pump actuation delivers 20 mg of diclofenac sodium in 1 gram of solution.
                  
                     NDC Number & Size
                  
                  
                     
                     
                     
                        
                           
                               112 g bottle
                           
                           
                               NDC# 68788-8838-1
                           
                        
                     
                  
                  
                     Storage
                  
                  Store at 20°C to 25°C (68°F to 77°F); excursions permitted from 15°C to 30°C (59°F to 86°F) [see USP Controlled Room Temperature].
adverseReactions_original:
Diclofenac sodium topical solution is contraindicated in the following patients: 
                  
                     
                        •Known hypersensitivity (e.g., anaphylactic reactions and serious skin reactions) to diclofenac or any components of the drug product [see Warnings and Precautions (5.7,  5.9)]
                     
                     
                        •History of asthma, urticaria, or other allergic-type reactions after taking aspirin or other NSAIDs. Severe, sometimes fatal, anaphylactic reactions to NSAIDs have been reported in such patients [see Warnings and Precautions (5.7,  5.8)]
                     
                     
                        •In the setting of coronary artery bypass graft (CABG) surgery [see Warnings and Precautions (5.1)]
